humanum_full_description_en:
From " speak " to " wind " sound. The original meaning is recitation. "Said Wen": "Satisfaction, chanting. From words, wind and sound." "Said Wen" uses " satisfaction " and " reciting " to teach each other, but the original meaning of the two is actually different. "Zhou Li. Chunguan. Great musicians to ":" to music language to teach the son: Xing Road, satirical, chanting, words, words. "Zheng Xuan's Note:" times the text reads satirical to say chanting voice Festival "," satirical "means not open-book Recitation, and " reciting " is a rhythmic reading. See " reciting ".

Examples of " satisfaction " used for recitation are as in "Lunheng. "Zi Ji": "The handwritten script has been completed, and the dictator is accepted by "The Analects" and "Shangshu", which satisfies a thousand characters every day." "Han Shu. "Yiwenzhi": "Students in the Taishi Examination, who can satirize books with more than 9,000 words, they must be history." "The Biography of Wu Yanshi, Lu and Zhao": "Should I receive the "Zuo Shi Zhuan" from Yingchuan and Tangxi, I can satirize it in ten days, and the code is deeply respected."

By extension, " sarcasm " refers to reading aloud and recitation. Such as "Xunzi. "Roughly speaking": "Soon or not, no matter how strong it is, it's okay, but it's not done." Yang Jie's note: "Satisfaction means learning to satirize "Poetry" and "Book"." "Historical Records. "Comic Biography": "The doctor today cultivated the skills of the first king, admired the righteousness of the saint, and satirized the words of the "Book of Poetry", which are innumerable." "Lun Heng. "Cheng Cai": "The nature of the Confucian students is good, but they are all good. They are subdued to the sacred religion and chanted day and night, and they are controlled by the sage."

" Ironic " also means using euphemistic language to suggest and persuade. "Jade articles. Yanbu: "Ironic, as an analogy." "Guang Ya. Interpretation IV: "Ironic, Admonishment." Such as "Historical Records. "Comical Biography": "You Meng, so Chu is also a happy person. It is eight feet long, and is often argued, often with talk and laughter." The Biography of Du Luan, Liu, Li, and Liu Xie: "There are five admonitions in courtesy, and satire is the best." Li Xian's note: "The admonisher is satirized, and he knows the adversity of adversity, and he satisfies it." "Wen Xin Diao Long. Humor": "Xiqi is prestigious and joyous, while Chunyu speaks of sweet wine; Chu Xiangyan's collection, and Song Yufu's lust; intended to be slightly ironic, and there are enough viewers."

" Iron " also means satire and sarcasm. For example, in the Northern Song Dynasty, Su Shi "Send Li Gongshu": "The police are sitting with wine and drinking, mixed with ridicule in "Poems" and "Sao"." Ming Dynasty Liu Ji "Selling oranges": "Why is it a cynical person? Entrust Yugan to ridicule?" "Jin Ping Mei" Chapter 76: "Why does he listen to people quietly and act to ridicule people."
humanum_short_description_en: From " speak " to " wind " sound. The original meaning is recitation.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「風」聲。本義是背誦。《說文》：「諷，誦也。从言，風聲。」《說文》以「諷」、「誦」互訓，但兩者的本義其實有區別。《周禮．春官．大司樂》：「以樂語教國子：興、道、諷、誦、言、語。」鄭玄注：「倍文曰諷，以聲節之曰誦。」「諷」指不開卷的背誦，而「誦」則是帶有節律的朗讀。參見「誦」。

　　「諷」用作背誦義的例子如《論衡．自紀》：「手書既成，辭師受《論語》、《尚書》，日諷千字。」《漢書．藝文志》：「太史試學童，能諷書九千字以上，乃得為史。」《後漢書．吳延史盧趙列傳》：「少從潁川唐溪典受《左氏傳》，旬日能諷之，典深敬焉。」

　　「諷」引申泛指朗讀、誦讀。如《荀子．大略》：「少不諷誦，壯不論議，雖可，未成也。」楊倞注：「諷謂就學諷《詩》《書》也。」《史記．滑稽列傳》：「今子大夫修先王之術，慕聖人之義，諷誦《詩書》百家之言，不可勝數。」《論衡．程材》：「儒生之性，非能皆善也，被服聖教，日夜諷詠，得聖人之操矣。」

　　「諷」又表示用委婉的語言暗示、勸諫。《玉篇．言部》：「諷，譬喻也。」《廣雅．釋詁四》：「諷，諫也。」如《史記．滑稽列傳》：「優孟，故楚之樂人也。長八尺，多辯，常以談笑諷諫。」《後漢書．杜欒劉李劉謝列傳》：「禮有五諫，諷為上。」李賢注：「諷諫者，知患禍之萌而諷告也。」《文心雕龍．諧讔》：「昔齊威酣樂，而淳于說甘酒；楚襄讌集，而宋玉賦好色；意在微諷，有足觀者。」

　　「諷」也表示諷刺、譏諷。如北宋蘇軾〈送李公恕〉：「酒酣簧坐語警眾，雜以嘲諷窮《詩》《騷》。」明代劉基〈賣柑者言〉：「豈其憤世嫉邪者耶？而託於柑以諷耶？」《金瓶梅》第76回：「他怎的會悄悄聽人，行動拿話兒譏諷人。」

feng3
HSK 5: 諷,讽
(Simplified: 讽)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 風 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 風 [ fēng ] wind; air; customs, manners; news
①不看着書本念，背書：諷誦(抑揚頓挫地誦讀)。諷詠。
②用含蓄的話勸告或譏刺：諷刺。諷諫(不直指其事，而用委婉曲折的言語進諫)。諷喻(一種修辭手法，用說故事等方式說明事物的道理)。諷一勸百。
諷刺 [ fěng cì ]: to satirize; to mock; irony; satire; sarcasm
諷喻 [ fěng yù ]: parable; allegory; satire
(Simplified: 讽)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 風 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 5
Chinese: Imagine a group of children mocking another child. It's like a windstorm of nasty words being throw around.
Meaning: mock
Hanzi: 讽
Story: Imagine a group of children mocking another child. It's like a windstorm of nasty words being throw around.
Kind: traditional

從「 言 」，「 風 」聲。本義是背誦。《說文》：「諷，誦也。从言，風聲。」《說文》以「 諷 」、「 誦 」互訓，但兩者的本義其實有區別。《周禮．春官．大司樂》：「以樂語教國子：興、道、諷、誦、言、語。」鄭玄注：「倍文曰諷，以聲節之曰誦。」「 諷 」指不開卷的背誦，而「 誦 」則是帶有節律的朗讀。參見「 誦 」。 「 諷 」用作背誦義的例子如《論衡．自紀》：「手書既成，辭師受《論語》、《尚書》，日諷千字。」《漢書．藝文志》：「太史試學童，能諷書九千字以上，乃得為史。」《後漢書．吳延史盧趙列傳》：「少從潁川唐溪典受《左氏傳》，旬日能諷之，典深敬焉。」 「 諷 」引申泛指朗讀、誦讀。如《荀子．大略》：「少不諷誦，壯不論議，雖可，未成也。」楊倞注：「諷謂就學諷《詩》《書》也。」《史記．滑稽列傳》：「今子大夫修先王之術，慕聖人之義，諷誦《詩書》百家之言，不可勝數。」《論衡．程材》：「儒生之性，非能皆善也，被服聖教，日夜諷詠，得聖人之操矣。」 「 諷 」又表示用委婉的語言暗示、勸諫。《玉篇．言部》：「諷，譬喻也。」《廣雅．釋詁四》：「諷，諫也。」如《史記．滑稽列傳》：「優孟，故楚之樂人也。長八尺，多辯，常以談笑諷諫。」《後漢書．杜欒劉李劉謝列傳》：「禮有五諫，諷為上。」李賢注：「諷諫者，知患禍之萌而諷告也。」《文心雕龍．諧讔》：「昔齊威酣樂，而淳于說甘酒；楚襄讌集，而宋玉賦好色；意在微諷，有足觀者。」 「 諷 」也表示諷刺、譏諷。如北宋蘇軾〈送李公恕〉：「酒酣簧坐語警眾，雜以嘲諷窮《詩》《騷》。」明代劉基〈賣柑者言〉：「豈其憤世嫉邪者耶？而託於柑以諷耶？」《金瓶梅》第76回：「他怎的會悄悄聽人，行動拿話兒譏諷人。」

諷字的基本解释

諷
fěng
见“讽”。

諷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fěng］
［《廣韻》方鳳切，去送，非。］
“讽1”的繁体字。“風3”的被通假字。
(1)背诵。
(2)泛指诵读，诵念。
(3)用委婉的语言暗示、劝告或讥刺、指责。

諷字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　諷； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1172第02
【唐韻】芬鳳切【集韻】【韻會】方鳳切，?風去聲。【說文】誦也。【周禮·春官·大司樂】以樂語敎國子，興道諷誦言語。【註】倍文曰諷，以聲節之曰誦。【前漢·藝文志】太史試，學童能諷書九千字以上，乃得爲史。【晉書·阮瞻傳】諷誦遺言，不若親承音旨。　又【廣雅】敎也。【玉篇】譬喩也。【集韻】諫刺也。【增韻】託音曰諷。【史記·滑稽傳】優孟常以談笑諷諫。【家語】忠臣之諫君有五義焉，吾從其諷諫乎。【白虎通】諷者，智也。患禍之萌流，睹其事未彰而諷告，此智性也。又與風通。【詩·國風·關雎序】風，風也。【註】上如字，下卽諷字。崔靈恩云：用風感物，則謂之諷。又【小雅】或出入風議。【箋】風猶放也。卽諷議。【前漢·嚴助傳】令助諭意，風指於南越。【師古註】以天子之意指諷告也。　又【廣韻】方馮切，音風。亦誦也。一曰告也。

諷字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
諷字的起名意思

暂无。

[You Ji 1] [Words Department] 　 Satire; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1172 No. 02
[Tang Yun] Fen Feng Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Fang Feng Qi,? The wind goes away. 【Said Wen】Recite also. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Da Si Le】Teach the son of the country with music, and chant the words of Taoist satire. [Note] Beiwen is said to be satire, and it is recited as syllable. [Pre-Han·Yiwenzhi] Taishi Exam, if students can satirize books with more than 9,000 words, it is for history. [Jin Shu·Ruan Zhan Biography] The satirical chanting of the last words is not as good as a personal inheritance.　[Guang Ya] again. [Jade articles] For example, also. [Ji Yun] Admonishment also. [Add rhyme] Suoyin said satire. [Historical Records·Comical Biography] You Meng often talks and laughs and satirizes. [Family language] The admonishment of the loyal minister has five righteousnesses, and I am almost ironic from it. [Baihutong] Satire, Zhiya. The sprouting stream of misfortune, irony after seeing the matter is not revealed, this is also wise. It is also connected with the wind. 【Poetry·National Style·Guanju Preface】Wind, wind also. [Note] The above is like the word, and the next is a satire. Cui Lingenyun: It is ironic to use the wind to feel things. Also [Xiaoya] or go in and out of the wind. [J] The wind is still letting go. Ironically. [Previous Han · Yan Zhuan] Ling Zhuan means that the wind refers to Nanyue. [Shigu Note] It is also a satire in the meaning of the emperor.　[Guangyun] Fang Fengqie, sound and wind. Also recite. One said to tell.
